publicwhip.spmotion: *S3M-7006 Kenneth Gibson: CrossReach Scotland—That the Parliament acknowledges and commends the 2,000 committed staff working for CrossReach across Scotland; notes what it considers their determination and dedication to improving the lives of those most in need on a daily basis; understands that 3,000 people are offered unconditional support and assistance every day through the services offered by CrossReach, which include children’s services, counselling and support, criminal justice, homeless people, learning disabilities, mental health, older people and substance misuse; is aware that over 67% of CrossReach staff are now appropriately qualified and that 171 have gained qualifications in the last year; recognises that 94% of services were graded good to excellent for quality of care and support and that two staff were finalists in the Scottish Care awards, and appreciates that Adams House in Elderslie was a finalist at the Great British Care Homes Awards and that the Oasis Centre at Garelochhead received a bronze COSLA Excellence award. Supported by: Jackie Baillie*, Rob Gibson*, Alasdair Allan*, Stuart McMillan*, Gil Paterson*, Robin Harper*, Bill Kidd*
